page.title: 20Weather in Glenisla_ Effects
page.content: 1985 was a particularly bad year weather-wise for farmers. The summer was a wash-out and the grain crop suffered very badly. Many farmers lost a substantial quantity of hay resulting in a shortage of winter feeding. 1982 and 1983 were memorable for their severe winters. The winter of 1982 was extremely cold with severe frost for weeks on end. 1983 gave us much more snow than usual resulting in problems for the farmers with livestock to feed. Roads were badly affected for long periods of time. The local school was closed on many occasions and the children from more outlying areas did not attend school for six weeks. Snow ploughs were hard pushed to keep up and snow blowers were needed many times to open roads.
